CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It is also noteworthy that , the short circuit current of the devices increased with an increase in the number of perylene units in the polymer , except for the case of PFDTBT_20Per. Even though PFDTBT_20Per showed the highest hole mobility among the PFDTBT - based copolymers , it is UV - visible absorption spectrum showed greater blue - shifting than PFDTBT , as shown in Figures 2 and 3 , and it showed the widest band gap energy among all of the polymers considered herein. This may be why the short circuit current of the device fabricated using PFDTBT_20Per is lower than that of PFDTBT , despite it higher mobility. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the best photovoltaic performance among the PFDTBT - based polymers ( V oc = 0.74 V , J sc = 7.19 mA / cm^2 , PCE = 2.16% ). For the photovoltaic devices fabricated using PFD2TBT - based polymers , the shortcircuit currents of the devices also increased as the perylene content in the copolymers increased ; however , the PCEs of the devices using PFD2TBT - based polymers were lower than those of PFDTBT - based polymers because of lower open - circuit voltages and short - circuit currents. The device fabricated using PFD2TBT_10Per showed the highest PCE ( 1.51% ) among the PFD2TBT - based polymers. The characteristics of the ITO / 4. Figure 8 shows that the J-V characteristics of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices provide a similar trend to those of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices but their PCEs increased mainly due to increased short circuit currents. The increase in the short circuit current originates from the introduction of the thin titanium suboxide ( TiO x ) layer ( ca. ∼ 10 nm ). The titanium suboxide layer could block holes to the aluminum electrode , thus it could increase the short circuit current of the photovoltaic device. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the highest PCE of 3.16% with an open circuit voltage of 0.81 V , a short circuit current of 9.61 mA / cm^2 and the highest fill factor ( 0.41 ) among the fabricated devices. The characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices are summarized in Table 5. Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices. The absorption onset corresponding to the photon - to - current conversion efficiency was about 750 nm for these devices , and the absorption onset values corresponding to the maximum conversion efficiency values were 427 and 560 nm. The morphologies of the polymers and PC71BM blend films were observed by tapping - mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PFDTBT - based copolymers: These are copolymers that contain perylene units and are based on PFDTBT.
2. PFDTBT: This is a polymer material, specifically a conjugated polymer used in organic electronics.
3. PFD2TBT - based polymers: These are copolymers that contain perylene units and are based on PFD2TBT.
4. ITO: This stands for Indium Tin Oxide, a transparent conducting oxide that is commonly used as a transparent electrode in optoelectronic devices.
5. PEDOT:PSS: This is a polymer material that is a combination of poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (PEDOT) and poly(styrenesulfonate) (PSS). It is often used as a hole-injecting layer in organic electronic devices.
6. PC71BM: This is a fullerene derivative that is commonly used as an electron-transporting material in organic solar cells.
7. TiO x : This is a thin titanium suboxide layer that is used in the photovoltaic devices to block holes and increase the short circuit current.
8. LiF: This is a salt that is used as an electron-injecting layer in organic electronic devices.
9. Al: This is aluminum, which is used as an electrode in the photovoltaic devices.
10. The morphologies of the polymers and PC71BM blend films: These are materials that are observed by tapping-mode atomic force microscopy (AFM).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PFDTBT - based copolymers
2. PFDTBT
3. PFD2TBT - based polymers
4. ITO
5. PEDOT:PSS
6. PC71BM
7. TiO x
8. LiF
9. Al

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It is also noteworthy that , the short circuit current of the devices increased with an increase in the number of perylene units in the polymer , except for the case of PFDTBT_20Per. Even though PFDTBT_20Per showed the highest hole mobility among the PFDTBT - based copolymers , it is UV - visible absorption spectrum showed greater blue - shifting than PFDTBT , as shown in Figures 2 and 3 , and it showed the widest band gap energy among all of the polymers considered herein. This may be why the short circuit current of the device fabricated using PFDTBT_20Per is lower than that of PFDTBT , despite it higher mobility. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the best photovoltaic performance among the PFDTBT - based polymers ( V oc = 0.74 V , J sc = 7.19 mA / cm^2 , PCE = 2.16% ). For the photovoltaic devices fabricated using PFD2TBT - based polymers , the shortcircuit currents of the devices also increased as the perylene content in the copolymers increased ; however , the PCEs of the devices using PFD2TBT - based polymers were lower than those of PFDTBT - based polymers because of lower open - circuit voltages and short - circuit currents. The device fabricated using PFD2TBT_10Per showed the highest PCE ( 1.51% ) among the PFD2TBT - based polymers. The characteristics of the ITO / 4. Figure 8 shows that the J-V characteristics of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices provide a similar trend to those of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al devices but their PCEs increased mainly due to increased short circuit currents. The increase in the short circuit current originates from the introduction of the thin titanium suboxide ( TiO x ) layer ( ca. ∼ 10 nm ). The titanium suboxide layer could block holes to the aluminum electrode , thus it could increase the short circuit current of the photovoltaic device. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the highest PCE of 3.16% with an open circuit voltage of 0.81 V , a short circuit current of 9.61 mA / cm^2 and the highest fill factor ( 0.41 ) among the fabricated devices. The characteristics of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / TiO x / Al devices are summarized in Table 5. Figure 9 shows the incident photon - to - current conversion efficiency ( IPCE ) spectra of the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices. The absorption onset corresponding to the photon - to - current conversion efficiency was about 750 nm for these devices , and the absorption onset values corresponding to the maximum conversion efficiency values were 427 and 560 nm. The morphologies of the polymers and PC71BM blend films were observed by tapping - mode atomic force microscopy ( AFM ).

Let's think step by step.

1. The short circuit current (Jsc) of the devices increased with an increase in the number of perylene units in the polymer, except for the case of PFDTBT_20Per. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per showed the best photovoltaic performance among the PFDTBT-based polymers with Jsc = 7.19 mA/cm^2.
2. The short-circuit currents of the devices also increased as the perylene content in the copolymers increased for the photovoltaic devices fabricated using PFD2TBT-based polymers. The device fabricated using PFD2TBT_10Per showed the highest PCE of 1.51% among the PFD2TBT-based polymers.
3. The device fabricated using PFDTBT-10Per with a TiO x layer showed the highest PCE of 3.16% with an open circuit voltage of 0.81 V, a short circuit current of 9.61 mA/cm^2, and the highest fill factor of 0.41 among the fabricated devices.
4. The absorption onset corresponding to the photon-to-current conversion efficiency was about 750 nm for the ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PFDTBT-10Per + PC71BM / LiF and TiO x / Al devices. The absorption onset values corresponding to the maximum conversion efficiency values were 427 and 560 nm.

Material properties with their values in the paragraph are:

1. Short circuit current (Jsc) of devices based on PFDTBT polymers: up to 7.19 mA/cm^2
2. Short circuit current (Jsc) of devices based on PFD2TBT polymers: up to 5.52 mA/cm^2 (calculated from PCE and fill factor)
3. Open circuit voltage (Voc): up to 0.81 V
4. Fill factor: up to 0.41
5. Absorption onset: 750 nm
6. Maximum conversion efficiency absorption onset: 427 and 560 nm.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Short circuit current (Jsc) of devices based on PFDTBT polymers: 7.19 mA/cm^2
2. Short circuit current (Jsc) of devices based on PFD2TBT polymers: 5.52 mA/cm^2
3. Open circuit voltage (Voc): 0.81 V
4. Fill factor: 0.41
5. Absorption onset: 750 nm
6. Maximum conversion efficiency absorption onset: 427 and 560 nm.

Note: The short circuit current value of 5.52 mA/cm^2 for PFD2TBT-based polymers is calculated by using the PCE value (1.51%) and the fill factor (0.41).
